div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1774 Babylon, Babylonia, 1900 (116) Burial: c. 155-150 B.C. Contents: 100 AR tetradr. From excavations Alexander III: 43 late post. tetradr. ( Cal- latis ? 1, Mesembria 1, Assus 1, Cyme 2, Myrina 3, Temnus 7, Mytilene 3, Colophon 1, Magnesia 1, Miletus 1, Smyrna 1, Chios 5, Cos 1, Rhodes 2, Phaselis 2, Aspendus 9, Perge 1, unc. 1) Lysimachus: 4 lifetime tetradr. ( Lamp- sacus 2, Alexandreia Troas 1, unc. 1) 7 post. tetradr. ( Byzantium 3, Calchedon 2, Tenedos 1, unc. 1) Samothrace: 1 tetradr. Eretria: 3 tetradr. Athens: 1 New Style tetradr. Mithradates III, Pontus: 1 tetradr. Cyzicus: 1 tetradr. Eumenes II: 8 tetradr. Alexandreia Troas: 1 tetradr. Ilium: 5 tetradr. Mytilene: 1 tetradr. Cos: 2 tetradr. Side: 6 tetradr. Seleucus II: 1 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Antiochus IV: 3 tetradr. (Antiocheia 1, Ace 2) Demetrius I: 12 tetradr. (Antiocheia 11, Ace 1) Disposition: Berlin Regling, ZfN 1928, pp. 92-132, illus.
